conversation.message:
Dear Student_E,

Thank you for your message and for reaffirming that you are ready to accept immediately if eligible.

On your question about what we would treat as “definitively no longer available” for Student_D, Student_A, and Student_C: within our process, we would consider a higher-priority student no longer available for our seat if one of the following occurs:

1) They become matched elsewhere through an accepted offer (i.e., they are no longer participating in further rounds).
2) They explicitly withdraw from consideration at School_D (a clear statement that they will not apply/accept School_D).
3) The overall process reaches a formal close/finalization point where unmatched higher-priority candidates are no longer able to initiate or complete an application to School_D.

Absent one of those conditions, we must continue to treat higher-priority candidates as potentially available and keep the seat open accordingly.

We can certainly keep your file noted as an active, ready-to-accept candidate. If at any point the higher-priority candidates ahead of you become definitively unavailable under the conditions above, we will be able to move quickly.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions Committee
